problem.markdown:
>>M/M/1 Queues (check all that apply): << [ ] Are systems that have M number of servers. [x] Are systems that have have one server.
[x] Are systems where arrivals are determined by a Poisson process.
[x] Are systems where arrival times are exponentially distributed.
[x] Are systems that have average arrival rate, \(\lambda\).
[ ] Are systems that have a time-varying service rate, \(\mu = \mu(t)\).
[x] Are systems where job service times are exponentially distributed.
[x] Are systems whose processes are Markovian. [explanation] M/M/1 queues represents the queue length in a system that has one server, where arrival times and job service times are exponentially distributed and determined by a Poisson process with constant arrival and service rates \(\rho\) and \(\lambda\), respectively.
[explanation]

checkboxgroup.choice: Are systems that have M number of servers.
Are systems that have have one server.
Are systems where arrivals are determined by a Poisson process.
Are systems where arrival times are exponentially distributed.
Are systems that have average arrival rate, \(\lambda\).
Are systems that have a time-varying service rate, \(\mu = \mu(t)\).
Are systems where job service times are exponentially distributed.
Are systems whose processes are Markovian.

div.p: M/M/1 queues represents the queue length in a system that has one server, where arrival times and job service times are exponentially distributed and determined by a Poisson process with constant arrival and service rates \(\rho\) and \(\lambda\), respectively.
